title: Players should have to go through a 3-part check system before being eligible to join a Ranked Queue
body:
1. File check. It needs to make sure that all necessary Direct X versions have been installed and that the game files are complete and not corrupted.

2. System check. It needs to make sure players aren't going to be loading into games with their shitty school laptops at 15 FPS.

3. Ping check. It needs to make sure people aren't going to start complaining about lag before minions even spawn.

If Riot really wants to not be at fault when people disconnects and loses several innocent players a 40+ minute Ranked match, a system at least somewhat resembling this needs to be implemented. Until then, Riot can start giving people Loss Forgiven every time some ignorant twat DCs from a Ranked match because they don't have the moral conscience to check their ping to make sure they're not going to be a burden to 4 other people.

replies.body:
For the ping check,

Windows
1. Open command prompt 'cmd'
2. Type: ping google.com
See your ms ping there

Mac
1. Open your terminal
2. Type: ping google.com
See your ms ping there

If you do not know how to achieve any of the mentioned points above, you can google it.

Bro, I've known how to check my ping since I was like 12. That's not the point.

My point is that players have no accountability. They rarely have the forethought or moral conscience to run a ping test before they join a ranked game and often spend half of it constantly lagging or disconnecting. That's why I'm saying it needs to be mandatory and they need to be prevented from playing if it's clear that they're going to compromise the competitive integrity of a game.
